cause.description:
Servicemembers United (SU) - a non-profit, non-partisan organization - is the nation's largest organization of gay and lesbian troops and veterans and the straight allies who support their service. SU strives to give those actually impacted by "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" a leading role in the debate surrounding the fate of the ill begotten policy and to hasten the policy's demise.
1. Through discharge of highly specialized personnel during a severe recruitment draught, DADT is detrimental to national security.
2. Due to a generation change and exponential progress in the promotion of gay acceptance, DADT is antiquated, and must be reexamined.
3. There is no factual justification for keeping the policy in place, while there are volumes of research indicating open sexuality in the military would
4. As DADT is the status quo, repeal is impossible without increased public interest through renewed debate and constant media exposure.
cause.mission: To encourage a pragmatic reexamination of 'Don't Ask Don't Tell' through constant education and exposure as to the realities of the law and those that serve under it.
cause.name: Servicemembers United - Official Facebook Cause
